Title: Nvidia’s RTX 50-Series Cards Fail to Preserve Our Favorite Games From 10 Years Ago
Description: Nvidia dropping 32-bit PhysX from the RTX 50-series' CUDA infrastructure is another sign that game preservation can't depend on those making gaming hardware.

Title: National Park Service in Turmoil After 1,000 Staff Abruptly Cut
Description:
An advocacy group is gravely concerned about forced exits of hundreds of rangers, interpreters, and administrative staff in U.S.
national parks.

Title: Fit for a pontiff: Inside the Roman hospital caring for Pope Francis
Description: The Gemelli hospital has been treating popes for more than thirty years.

Title: Are planes crashing more often?
Description: A recent flurry of air disasters have made some people worried about flying - but are crashes on the rise?

Title: Dead soldier's sister says army 'not safe' for women
Description: Gunner Jaysley Beck's sister says she would not advise other women to join the Army.

Title: A brief history of beards and baseball after the Yankees lift their no beard policy
Description:
The New York Yankees are changing a nearly 50-year-old policy that banned beards.
Here are some things to know about the history of beards in major league baseball.

Title: Arab leaders huddle in Saudi Arabia in pushback to Trump's Gaza plans
Description: Leaders from Egypt, Jordan and other Arab states met in Saudi Arabia to discuss alternative plans for Gaza's future than the one laid out by President Trump, which calls for displacing Palestinians.

Title: Hamas releases Israeli hostages, returns remains of Shiri Bibas
Description: Hamas to release the last six live hostages whose freedom they agreed to under the current ceasefire deal.

Title: Your apartment building is made of steel — and Trump's trade plans could mean higher rent
Description: Larger buildings require more steel in their framing and foundations, so apartments and condos will likely be more impacted by the tariffs.

Title: A billionaire paid $26.5 million for an Aspen compound. Now he's trying to sell it for a record-setting $125 million.
Description:
One of the Koch brothers has relisted his Aspen estate for its highest-ever price: $125 million.
It could break a state record set just last year.

Title: The West is hastily taking notes from Ukraine and gearing up for future drone wars
Description:
Russia and Ukraine are heavily using drones, with the tactics and technology rapidly evolving.
NATO nations are taking note and action.

Title: The US Space Force needs a 'warfighting ethos' and increased funding to compete with China in space: report
Description: The US Space Force faces "systemic issues" that threaten its long-term chances of success against China, a report argues.

Title: I visited offices in the Silicon Slopes and learned why Utah's booming tech hub is top-rated for creating workplaces that lure employees in
Description:
The Silicon Slopes is a booming tech hub in Utah.
I visited to see why its top ranked for its work environment.

Title: Here's what happened to the migrant detainees at Guantanamo Bay
Description: Immigration and Customs Enforcement transported 177 migrants from Guantanamo Bay to Honduras for final removal to Venezuela, according to a post on X from the agency.

Title: Is your phone listening to everything you say? It’s complicated
Description: Google, Instagram, Facebook and weather apps can track your location and use that data to serve you ads; here's what you can do to protect your privacy.

Title: The 40th Anniversary of ProVUE at Macworld Expo
Description:
February 21, 2025 - Forty years ago today the doors opened for the very first MacWorld Expo in the Brooks Hall basement in San Francisco.
For most of you this event probably seems like ancient history, somewhere back in the mists of time.
But for me this was …

Title: ‘Ready’ Is the New ‘Approved’
Description: Attached: 2 images Looks like Apple changed the wording of Notarization emails to no longer say “approved,” wonder what caused that!

Title: Texas’s Barbecue Schism
Description: Rachel Monroe on how barbecue in Texas has continued to change as the state becomes more urban, and one family’s feud over how the food should be prepared and served.

Title: Before He Formed Led Zeppelin, Jimmy Page Played a Prom in Ohio
Description: David Owen writes about the Led Zepplin guitarist, Jimmy Page, and a performance he gave with his previous band, the Yardbirds, in 1968, at a high-school prom in Cincinnati.

Title: Docker delays Hub pull limits by a month, tweaks maximums, stalls storage billing indefinitely
Description: Image fetches to be capped on hourly basis for Personal, unauthenticated use, paid-for plans get unlimited access Docker has delayed its plan to limit image pulls – the downloading of container images – from Docker Hub, by one month and has altered previously…
